title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 29 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The launch will be the 350th overall orbital launch from Space Launch Complex 40. SpaceX is targeting liftoff of the Starlink 6-95 mission at 3:16 p.m. EST (2016 UTC).

title: Arianespace launches South Korean Earth observation satellite on Vega-C flight
summary: The mission was the sixth launch of a Vega-C rocket to date. Liftoff from Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana occurred at 2:21 p.m. local time (12:21 p.m. EST / 1721 UTC).

title: Reditus Space joins reusable satellite wave with $7 million seed round
summary:
Reditus Space announced $7.1 million in seed funding to fly its first reusable spacecraft next summer, joining a wave of startups emerging from stealth in microgravity research and in-space manufacturing.
The post Reditus Space joins reusable satellite wave with $7 million seed round appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Spire to build eight satellites for Deloitte’s on-orbit cybersecurity program
summary:
The deal expands a partnership that began earlier this year, when Deloitte launched Deloitte-1 on SpaceX’s Transporter-13 rideshare mission. 
The post Spire to build eight satellites for Deloitte’s on-orbit cybersecurity program appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: What is AI? (Grades 5-8)
summary: This article is for students grades 5-8. What is AI? Artificial intelligence, or AI, is a type of technology that helps machines and computers have “thinking” abilities similar to humans. Devices using AI can learn words and concepts, recognize objects, see patterns, or make predictions. They can also be taught how to work autonomously. AI […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 60th Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB in 2025
summary: The Starlink 15-10 mission will add 27 broadband internet satellites into the low Earth orbit constellation. SpaceX is targeting liftoff from pad 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base at 9:28 p.m. PST (12:28 a.m. EST / 0528 UTC).

title: Sagittarius B2 Molecular Cloud
summary: The Mid-Infrared Instrument (MIRI) on NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope captured glowing cosmic dust heated by very young massive stars in unprecedented detail in this image of the Sagittarius B2 (Sgr B2) molecular cloud released on Sept. 24, 2025. Sgr B2 is the most massive, and active star-forming region in our galaxy, located only a […]

title: Space CEO explains why he believes private space stations are a viable business
summary: Voyager Technologies Chairman Dylan Taylor checks in with Ars from the space station frontier.
